newsitem.title: GERMANY: German Praktiker sees 1996/97 profit fall.
newsitem.headline: German Praktiker sees 1996/97 profit fall.

text.p: German do-it-yourself and building materials chain Praktiker, a unit of retailer Metro AG, said on Friday it was unlikely this year to match last year's profits.

According to the text of a speech to be delivered by chairman Michael Arnold to the shareholders' meeting, Praktiker would be unable to catch up following a slump in first quarter pre-tax profits to 36.3 million marks from 52.3 million last time.
Profits from ordinary activities in the 1995/96 year stood at 201.8 million marks.
Arnold said costs related to new store openings had hit first quarter earnings, while increasing competition was also having an impact on profits.
For the current year as a whole, Praktiker sees gross turnover of 4.5 billion marks compared to 4.25 billion the year before.
